comment: In some regions, -embireko is for wife before having children and xe r-a'yxy is for wife after having children.

Acc. to Dietrich, it is common that the term for paternal uncle is used for stepfather; in many other TG languages, the term has the general sense of "foster father" (in portuguese, "pai de criação").
xe- is probably a first person singular possessive preffix.
